name: Abalone
description: Biomolecular simulations, protein folding.

name: ACEMD[1]
description: Molecular dynamics with CHARMM, Amber forcefields; runs on NVIDIA GPUs, highly optimized with CUDA

name: ADF
description: Modeling suite: ReaxFF, UFF, QM-MM with Amber and Tripos force fields, DFT and semi-empirical methods, conformational analysis with RDKit; partly GPU-accelerated

name: ADUN[2]
description: Charmm, AMBER, user specified (via force field markup language, FFML), QM-MM calculations with empirical valence bond (EVB); framework based (GNUStep-Cocoa); SCAAS for spherical boundary conditions

name: Assisted Model Building with Energy Refinement (AMBER)[3]
Ascalaph Designer
description: Molecular building (DNA, proteins, hydrocarbons, nanotubes), molecular dynamics, GPU acceleration
license: Mixed: free open source (GNU GPL) & commercial

name: Automated Topology Builder (ATB)
description: Automated molecular topology building service for small molecules (< 99 atoms). GROMOS, GROMACS, CNS, LAMMPS formats with validation Repository for molecular topologies and pre-equilibrated systems

name: Avogadro
description: Molecule building, editing (peptides, small molecules, crystals), conformational analysis, 2D/3D conversion; extensible interfaces to other tools

name: BOSS
description: OPLS

name: CHARMM
description: Commercial version with multiple graphical front ends is sold by Accelrys (as CHARMm)

name: CHEMKIN
description: Chemical reaction kinetics.

name: COSMOS
description: Hybrid QM-MM COSMOS-NMR force field with fast semi-empirical calculation of electrostatic and/or NMR properties; 3-D graphical molecule builder and viewer

name: CP2K
description: CP2K can perform atomistic and molecular simulations of solid state, liquid and biological systems.
license: Free open sourceGNU GPLv2 or later

name: Culgi
description: Atomistic simulations and mesoscale methods, database integration, mapping techniques, interface to MOPAC/NWChem

name: Desmond
description: High performance MD; has comprehensive GUI to build, visualize, and review results and calculation setup up and launch

name: Discovery Studio
description: Comprehensive life science modeling and simulation suite of applications focused on optimizing drug discovery process: small molecule simulations, QM-MM, pharmacophore modeling, QSAR, protein-ligand docking, protein homology modeling, sequence analysis, protein-protein docking, antibody modeling, etc.

name: DL_POLY
description: DL_POLY is a general purpose classical molecular dynamics (MD) simulation software developed at Daresbury Laboratory by I.T. Todorov and W. Smith.

name: Energy Calculation and Dynamics (ENCAD)
description: Notably the first MD simulation software by Michael Levitt

name: fold.it
description: University of Washington and The Baker Labs; structure prediction, protein folding

name: FoldX
description: Energy calculations, protein design

name: GPIUTMD
description: Performs general purpose particle dynamics simulations on a single workstation, exploiting NVIDIA CUDA GPUs

name: GROMACS
description: High performance MD

name: GROMOS
description: Intended for biomolecules

name: GULP
description: Molecular dynamics and lattice optimization

name: HOOMD-blue
description: General-purpose molecular dynamics highly optimized for GPUs, includes various pair potentials, Brownian dynamics, dissipative particle dynamics, rigid body constraints, energy minimizing, etc.

name: ICM
description: Powerful global optimizer in an arbitrary subset of internal variables, NOEs, docking (protein, ligand, peptide), EM, density placement

name: LAMMPS
description: Has potentials for soft and solid-state materials and coarse-grain systems

name: MacroModel
description: OPLS-AA, MMFF, GBSA solvent model, conformational sampling, minimizing, MD. Includes the Maestro GUI which provides visualizing, molecule building, calculation setup, job launch and monitoring, project-level organizing of results, access to a suite of other modelling programs.

name: MAPS
description: Building, visualizing, and analysis tools in one user interface, with access to multiple simulation engines

name: Materials Studio
description: Environment that brings materials simulation technology to desktop computing, solving key problems in R&D processes

name: MedeA
description: Combines leading experimental databases and major computational programs like the Vienna Ab-initio Simulation Package (VASP), LAMMPS, GIBBS with sophisticated materials property prediction, analysis, visualizing

name: MCCCS Towhee
description: Originally designed to predict fluid phase equilibria

name: MDynaMix
description: Parallel MD

name: MOE
description: Molecular Operating Environment (MOE)

name: MOIL
description: Includes action-based algorithms (stochastic difference equations in time, length) and locally enhanced sampling
license: Free open source, public domain, source code

name: Orac
description: Molecular dynamics simulation program to explore free energy surfaces in biomolecular systems at the atomic level

name: NAB[5]
description: Generates models for unusual DNA and RNA

name: NAMD + VMD
description: Fast, parallel MD, CUDA
license: Proprietary, free academic use, source code

name: NWChem
description: High-performance computational chemistry software, includes quantum mechanics, molecular dynamics and combined QM-MM methods
license: Free open source, Educational Community License version 2.0

name: Packmol
description: Builds complex initial configurations for molecular dynamics

name: Prime
description: Homology modeling, loop and side chain optimizing, minimizing, OPLS-AA, SGB solvent model, parallalized

name: Protein Local Optimization Program
description: Helix, loop, and side chain optimizing, fast energy minimizing

name: Q
description: (I) Free energy perturbation (FEP) simulations, (II) empirical valence bond (EVB), calculations of reaction free energies, (III) linear interaction energy (LIE) calculations of receptor-ligand binding affinities

name: RedMD[6]
description: Reduced MD, package for coarse-grained simulations

name: SAMSON
description: Computational nanoscience (life sciences, materials, etc.). Modular architecture, modules termed SAMSON Elements

name: StruMM3D (STR3DI32)
description: Sophisticated 3-D molecule builder and viewer, advanced structural analytical algorithms, full featured molecular modeling and quantitation of stereo-electronic effects, docking, and handling of complexes.

name: Scigress
description: MM, DFT, semiempirical methods, parallel MD, conformational analysis, Linear scaling SCF, docking protein-ligand, Batch processing, virtual screening, automated builders (molecular dynamics, proteins, crystals)

name: Spartan
description: Small molecule (< 2,000 a.m.u.) MM and QM tools to determine conformation, structure, property, spectra, reactivity, and selectivity.

name: TeraChem
description: High performance GPU-accelerated ab initio molecular dynamics and TD/DFT software package for very large molecular or even nanoscale systems. Runs on NVIDIAGPUs and 64-bit Linux, has heavily optimized CUDA code.

name: TINKER
description: Software tools for molecular design

name: Tremolo-X
description: Fast, parallel MD

name: UCSF Chimera
description: Visually appealing viewer, amino acid rotamers and other building, includes Antechamber and MMTK, Ambertools plugins in development.

name: VEGA ZZ
description: 3D viewer, multiple file format support, 2D and 3D editor, surface calculation, conformational analysis, MOPAC and NAMD interfaces, MD trajectory analysis, molecular docking, virtual screening, database engine, parallel design, OpenCL acceleration, etc.

name: VLifeMDS
description: Complete molecular modelling software, QSAR, combinatorial library generation, pharmacophore, cheminformatics, docking, etc.

name: WHAT IF
description: Visualizer for MD, interface to GROMACS

name: YASARA
description: Molecular graphics, modeling, simulation
